summary: Roger Bruce Myerson  is an American economist and co-winner, with Leonid Hurwicz and Eric Maskin, of the 2007 Nobel Prize in Economics "for having laid the foundations of mechanism design theory." He has made contributions as an economist, as an applied mathematician, and as a political scientist.
full_text:
Roger Bruce Myerson  is an American economist and winner of the Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel, sometimes referred to as the "Nobel Prize" for economics, with Leonid Hurwicz and Eric Maskin for "having laid the foundations of mechanism design theory." A professor at the University of Chicago, he has made contributions as an economist and as a political scientist.
^ "The Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel 2007" . Nobel Foundation. October 15, 2007. Retrieved 2008-08-15.
title: Roger Myerson
